titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2007 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on August 14, 2007

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, administrative papers, schedules, questionnaires, punched cards, tabulations, summaries, related materials on Conn. residents, industry, agriculture, and files of Charles A. Goodwin, head of the military census bureau, and Frank D. Cheney, director of the industrial survey.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In February 1917 the Connecticut General Assembly directed Governor Marcus H. Holcomb "to procure certain information relative to the resources of the State," especially about "men and materials available for use in the event of war."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Approximately 502,980 sheets of the manpower census were completed and arranged in numerical order. An index card was prepared for each sheet and arranged under each town alphabetically by surname. Each card gives the name, address, and form number. Known as the Military Census, the most significant part was a manpower census of all male inhabitants over the age of sixteen taken in 1917-1918. However, additional surveys included such things as farms, crops, livestock, automobiles, doctors, nurses, and factories.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Some of these records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: In 1988 and 1989 the Genealogical Society of Utah microfilmed the completed forms and index cards and provided the State Library with a donor copy of each series. The index cards are on 16mm microfilm arranged by town and then alphabetically by surname. If a card for a name is located, researchers should take down the form number(s). The forms are arranged numerically on 35mm microfilm. Researchers should consult Series 2 of this finding aid to find the microfilm roll that includes the form in question. Form numbers appear in the upper right hand corner of each sheet. Since numbers on many of the original forms are faded, researchers may have difficulty in reading them, but the sheets are in numerical order on the microfilm.

The State Archives is treating the microfilm as the use copy. Hence, access to the original sheets are subject to the . The History and Genealogy staff does not search or provide copies from microfilmed records, and the State Library's copies of these films are not available on inter-library loan. However, a list of who can make copies for a fee is available and films may be used at .

did.unitid: all except number 22, T000580; number 22, T003191

scopecontent.p: Mounted copies of forms, documents, newspaper clippings, and letters pertaining to the establishment of the Military Census and related surveys. There is a table of contents in the front.

bioghist.p: Goodwin was head of the Military Census Bureau.

scopecontent.p: Administrative materials, including copies of documents on the British Registration Act of 1915 and three notebooks containing summaries of the manpower census results.
State Library correspondence concerning the census, with copies of forms used, sample tables, instructions, summary reports and related materials.

arrangement.p: Correspondence is alphabetical. Other materials unarranged.

scopecontent.p: Requests for forms by firms.
Incoming and copies of outgoing correspondence.

did.unittitle: Records pertaining to Military Census compilations

scopecontent.p: Tables and lists of data collected in the Manpower Census, the Automobile Census and the Nurses' Census. Totals and names of registrants are shown by class (or "Group"), county, town, age group and occupation. Classes are follows: Class I, Citizens without dependents; Class II, Citizens with dependents; Class III, Physically unfit; Class IV, Holders of first papers for citizenship; Class V, Friendly aliens; Class VI, Enemy aliens. An itemized list of the files is at the beginning.

Fairfild and Litchfield farmes (photostat lists), wireless operators, with and without dependents (photostat), physicians (photostats and originals), nurses in Connecticut as of June 1918 (original and photostat), photographers (originals).

did.unittitle: 9. Lists of Fairfield County male residents age 16-20 without dependents

scopecontent.p: This is a list as prepared by the Bureau and sent to the towns for draft registration use.

did.unittitle: 10. Lists of Hartland men who registered in June 1917 and September 1918

scopecontent.p: Complete census of Waterbury (photostat and original), partial census of Greenwich (orignal), list of citizens refusing to answer the census agent (photostat), list of those men of Fairfield County that are eligible for military service, i.e., are 19 or 20 years old by June 1918 (original), male residents of Barkhamsted, age included (photostat), summary of draft age resources Hartford and Litchfield County (photostat), Bloomfield men age 21-30 from school register (original), Coventry men, age included (photostat), North Haven men, age included, non-residents with no information.
Men, age 21-30. Some photostats and some orignal copies.

arrangement.p: Boxes 13-22 arranged alphabetically by town. Boxes 23-24 arranged alphbetically by county.

did.unittitle: New Haven, New London, Tolland, Windham Counties
13. List of indivuduals who participated in taking the Waterbury census

scopecontent.p: Incomplete, some pages missing.

did.unittitle: 14. Lists of New Haven residents who are citizens

acqinfo.p: RESTRICTED. The microfilm listed in Series 2 is the use copy of these records.

scopecontent.p: Individual form reports filled ou by or for male inhabitants of Connecticut, giving information on personal history, training, experience, etc.

arrangement.p: Arranged numerically. Indexed by item 16 below.

scopecontent.p: Card index to item 15 above, giving name, address and questionnaire number.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by town, thereunder by name.

scopecontent.p: Punched cards carrying name, street and coded data from the questionnaires in item 15.

arrangement.p: Arranged in various groups, by occupation, age, nationality, etc.

note.p: The code has not been found and the cards could not be tabulated without repunching them.

did.unittitle: 18. Card record of volunteer census takers
Salem-Woodstock; Cards not matched with towns
18a. Card file of census information retained by towns

scopecontent.p: Two photostat copies and one partially complete orignial list.

did.unittitle: 1. Hartford; 2. New Haven; 3. New London; 4. Fairfield

scopecontent.p: Photostat copy only.

did.unittitle: 3. New London; 4. Fairfield; 5. Windham; 6. Middlesesx; 7. Litchfield; 8. Tolland

scopecontent.p: Compilations of aliens residing in the state.

did.unittitle: Records pertaining to the Agricultural Survey
22. Index to farm owners or operators

scopecontent.p: Card index or list containing name and address, with one or two reference numbers (questionnaire number and town code).
Punched cards recording data from the Agricultural Survey questionnaires (See item 29 below).

arrangement.p: Arranged by county and thereunder grouped by subject - acreage, livestock, crops, etc.

scopecontent.p: Citizen farmers with/without dependents; fit/unfit for service. Original and photostat copies.
Forms, instructions, codes, reports, fragmentary series of questionnaires and related materials.

arrangement.p: Summary tables by county, thereunder by product; by product, thereunder by county and town.

scopecontent.p: Incoming correspondence and copies of outgoing letters to and from George Goddard.

arrangement.p: This series is divided into two parts. The first arrangement is alphabetical by county; the second is a general file arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Original lists compiled for the Connecticut Agricultural Survey. Included are lists of tobacco and corn growers, acreage studies, farm machinery and livestock. The entire state is not represented.

did.unittitle: 29. Papers of the state-wide Agricultural Survey

scopecontent.p: Original questionnaires completed in compliance with the COnnecticut Council of Defense, agricultural survey. The survey includes questiones related to the land area, crops planted for 1917 and 1918, "probable area with adequate harvesting equipment," "machinery on hand" and "employees."

arrangement.p: The questionnaires are grouped roughly by county, apparently in the order in which they were received. A list is included in Box 41.

did.unittitle: Records pertaining to the Industrial Census

bioghist.p: Cheney was Director of the Industrial Census.

scopecontent.p: Form reports.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetical by name of company, followed by lists of committees, etc.

scopecontent.p: Form reports.

did.unittitle: Boats and Marine; Clothing; Contractors; Hospital; Leather; Metal

scopecontent.p: Form reports.

arrangement.p: Arranged numerically in the order in which they were received.

did.unittitle: 35. Records of corporations not involved in government work

scopecontent.p: Photostat list of corporations involved in the production of "metal, wood, textiles, miscellaneous, and clothing."
Original lists.
Form reports discarded by Frank D. Cheney "for no apparent reason."
Incoming and copies of outgoing correspondence, with both firms and residents.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

40. Sample forms used in taking the military census.
41. Clippings relating to the Military Census
42. Miscellaneous materials relating to the taking of the Military Census

Records pertaining to the Census of Nursing
45. Correspondence relating to completing census forms
46. Correspondence relating to locating doctors and nurses who have not registerd

acqinfo.p: Microfilm copy available for use copy. See History and Genealogy staff.

arrangement.p: Arranged roughly by classification. Code to classification system is in Box 76.

did.unittitle: Records pertaining to the Industrial Census

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of industry, then alphabetically by company name.

note.p: Microfilm located in the History and Genealogy reading room.

scopecontent.p: Sheets 63000-63649 are missing.
Sheets 73147-73326 and 73330-73341 are missing.
Sheets 266051-266099 are missing.
Sheets 266823-266999 are missing.

After sheet 502980 there are some miscellaneous numbered sheets of, "Non-resideents with no information"; and there are some non-numbered sheets of, "Refusals", "Army and Navy blanks from Groton", and "Somers, Connecticut" sheets (may be duplicates).
